isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - REASSEMBLE - SWIVEL MITER

svcproc.title: SWIVEL MITER
svcproc.para: The miter housing on the swivel miter input arrangement of the Sheppard integral power steering gear can be turned a full 360 degrees and clamped in the most desirable design location to complement the steering column and U-joint angles ( Figure 126).

figure.caption: Figure 126. Miter Housing Can be Turned 360 Degrees

note.para: A roll pin has been added in later models for locational purposes. This pin locks the miter clamp and miter housing together.

svcproc.para: A clamping bar on each side of the miter housing clamps the housing to the bearing cap. Two or three bolts pass through each bar and the bearing cap and thread into the steering gear housing ( Figure 127).

figure.caption: Figure 127. Install Clamping Bar on Each Side of Miter Housing

caution.para: The steering should not be operated with these bolts removed or loosened. High operating pressures may damage the bearing cap or bearing cap seals.

svcproc.para: Reverse the order of disassembly to reassemble using new parts as required ( Figure 128).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Reassemble, Using New Parts as Required

svcproc.para: After reassembly of the complete miter housing to the bearing cap, the backlash between the bevel gears must be checked. With the gears free of grease, turn the input shaft with the fingers to judge the clearance between the gears. Add or remove shims to obtain zero clearance ( Figure 129).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Turn Input Shaft to Judge Clearance Between Gears

svcproc.para: Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the correct grease for filling the miter housing.

The steering gear bearing cap and high pressure oil seal are serviced in the same manner as the fixed miter gear assembly. Refer to FIXED MITER
for complete details.
